__e: Well, now since you've took my food.
Well, well... You're going to wash it clean! Do not laugh, you idiot!
The boy washed his car, and took a look around.
- So did I. But then you let him come in here before I've washed my face. Ooh.
~ No, no, no, I'm... Never better, I'm... ~ I'll just go and splash my face with water. ~ Are you sure?
No more taking a shower, no more washing your face, no more doing whatever it is you do to your hair.
No more taking a shower, no more washing your face, no more doing whatever it is you do to your hair.
It's a stay-at-home kind of night, you know, washing the hair and everything.
You mean the guy who thinks he's too good to wash my car now?
It's always...it's always teatime and of course we don't get much time to wash the things up between whiles.
- You can lost work you want, but another mistake like this, and you go in the kitchen, washing the dishes, okay?
You can learn to do the shopping for the family... and maybe even do the dishes... but that doesn't exactly make you a mother.
Even if you wash his feet, and drink that water all your life you won't be able to repay his obligations to you!
Now come and help me wash your father's feet.
What can you sit on, sleep on and brush your teeth with?
And I'm not the one who has to hand wash it in the morning, so...
You don't need to wash your hands for the work I am about to make you do.
Or tomorrow you could be taking in washing.
To think how difficult it was back in those times to do something as simple as washing your clothes.
- Um, I don't mean to be a Dick, But I think it's your turn to do the laundry.
And I'm not the one who has to hand wash it in the morning, so...
You don't need to wash your hands for the work I am about to make you do.
Want me to go over to my dad's tonight and do laundry and then just fall asleep over there and then you can have your apartment just for you for the night?
Hey, the girls are one thing. I'll drive them around and keep them fed, but I don't do laundry.
Don't forget it's your turn to do the dishes tonight.
I find out the love of my life killed me, but it's OK, because at least now we can wash up!
I didn't know whether it was the food or Frank... or the fact that I didn't have to do the dishes.
And who wants to wash their hands, like, three times a day?
You could have drunk that, but you need to wash your dainties.
Want me to go over to my dad's tonight and do laundry and then just fall asleep over there and then you can have your apartment just for you for the night?
You are, and I believe today is laundry day.
I mean, I hate to do laundry more than anything in the whole world and I think this is probably the nicest thing anybody ever did for me.
I almost never get the house all to myself, and I thought with my mom gone... I can finally do my laundry exactly the way I like it.
That's another thing-- I gotta go back to Fluff and Fold now.
I don't feel too well, I'll go wash up, then sleep.
Tell her to wash her up and come on down.
